article.headline: As praries make a comback, bison roam

metadata.narrative_thread: ...because the grazing habits of bison help prairies grow.

content.question: Why does the prairie need help?
content.answer: During WWII, it served as an arsenal and produced 1 billion lbs. of TNT.

content.question: What's the difference between bison and buffalo?
content.answer: Bison have larger shoulder humps and massive heads and live only in North America.

content.description_text: Number of years it will take to evaluate whether the bison have improved the diversity of native plants and birds.
Midewin National Tallgrass Prairie, located about 50 miles southwest of Chicago.

content.question: Where else do the buffalo roam?
content.answer: The Nature Conservancy brought 30 bison to Nachusa Grasslands last year to help with prairie restoration; it was the first conservation herd in Illinois.

content.quote_attribution: Jeff Walk, director of science for the Illinois chapter of The Nature Conservancy
